definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Nerver forget that the lowest bidder made your weapon.
sentences.chinese: 別忘了你手上的武器是由出價最低的承包商製造的。

sentences.english: This declaration may give Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger the encouragement needed to launch a firm bid for Guti.
sentences.chinese: 這一番話可能會給阿瑟溫格爲古蒂出價的勇氣。

sentences.english: Please don't waste our time with a non-specific bid.
sentences.chinese: 請不要浪費我們的一個非特定出價時間。

sentences.english: Bids higher than $70 wont be considered.
sentences.chinese: 出價比不會被視爲七零美元高。

sentences.english: Liverpool are set to outbid West Ham United for Lazio midfielder Valon Behrami.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦在對貝赫拉米的出價上擊敗了西漢姆聯。

sentences.english: In a double auction, buyers and sellers both make price  bids.
sentences.chinese: 在複式拍賣中，買賣雙方都可以出價。

sentences.english: PLEASE DO NOT BID if you have not a previous cyclos installation to show me.
sentences.chinese: 請勿出價，如果你還沒有安裝以前的三輪車給我看。

sentences.english: Please place your bid specifying the time you will require to deliver the list.
sentences.chinese: 請於您的出價指定時間，你將需要提供的名單。

sentences.english: We offer him the house for $20.000.
sentences.chinese: 我們出價20000美圓賣給他那棟房子。

sentences.english: Competition between bidders for this valuable painting has been keen.
sentences.chinese: 拍賣時各出價人對這幅名畫競爭很激烈。

sentences.english: The worker bargained his services to the highest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 討價還價後這名工人受僱於出價最高的僱主。

sentences.english: The school singed a building contract with the lowest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 學校和最低的出價者簽了建築的合同。

sentences.english: That “what-the-hell price” could become a benchmark.
sentences.chinese: 自願出價“可能成爲一個標準。

sentences.english: These creditors would sell the assets to the highest bidder.
sentences.chinese: 債權人會把這些資產賣給出價最高的人。

sentences.english: It’s not uncommon to see 20-30 offers on one house.
sentences.chinese: 一棟房子有20到30個人出價，這是很常見的。

sentences.english: Oh, now the asking price is $90 each share.
sentences.chinese: 哦，現在賣出價每股90美元。

definition: to quote a price/seller's first offer
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
to purchase (from various places)/to acquire (a company)
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
